channel.title: Homes on Zhenyu's page
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Zhenyu's page

item.description: Bio Zhenyu Liao is a second year Ph.D. student, under the supervision of Prof. Romain Couillet and Prof. Yacine Chitour, with the Signals and Statistics group of Laboratoire des signaux et systèmes, CentraleSupélec, University Paris-Saclay. He received his B.Sc degree in Optical & Electronic Information from Huazhong University of Science & Technology, China and his M.Sc. degree in Signal and Image Processing from CentraleSupélec/Paris-Sud University, France in 2016. Curriculum vitae: Here is my CV in English.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Journals: C. Louart, Z. Liao, R. Couillet, “A Random Matrix Approach to Neural Networks”, (to appear) Annals of Applied Probability, 2017. [link] Z. Liao, R. Couillet, “A Large Dimensional Analysis of Least Squares Support Vector Machines”, (submitted to) Journal of Machine Learning Research, 2017. [link] Conferences: Z. Liao, R. Couillet, “Une Analyse des Méthodes de Projections Aléatoires par la Théorie des Matrices Aléatoires”, Colloque GRETSI’17, Juan Les Pins, France, 2017.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am a teaching assistant at CentraleSupélec, Signal and Statistics department, for the following courses: 2017- 2018: Lab work: Signals and systems 1. Together with Prof. LE BRUSQUET. 54 hours in total.

item.title: Activities
item.description: I’m reviewing for Neural Processing Letters IEEE Transactions on Signal Processing
